data.title: Add sample showing some Panda3D uses of libRocket.
data.body:
N.B.  This still uses the "from _rocketcore import rocket" hack.  

I noticed that 3rd-party Rocket files tend to have embedded Python in <script>> elements in *.rml, which expects "import rocket" to work.  And that doesn't work at all in Panda3D now, as we discussed, so both Panda3D *.py and *.rml files need the same hack.  

Thus, whatever fixes are made should probably include ensuring "import rocket" will work whether or not Panda3D's rocket module is loaded.

data.title: Fix a rash of asserts from PNMImage::get_alpha_val
Misc. fixes
data.body: Fixes for a few problems that I uncovered during the last `cmake` branch update.

data.title: Add -L (lighting) and -d <display> options to pview
data.body: In my workflow, I always need lighting (so textures show up) and prefer to use p3tinydisplay for faster startup.  This patch allows passing options to enable lighting and select the display.

data.title: Implement confined mouse mode for OS X.
data.body:
Note: it seems that using #set_pointer() will result in
a long delay before an absolute mouse position is updated,
even though deltas are reported.

Thus, in CocoaPandaView, the mouse deltas are sent for both
relative and confined modes, so client code (e.g. the "mouse
modes" demo) will be able to recenter the mouse without
choppy movement.

data.title: Support mouse confinement (Cocoa)
data.body:
As for the findings yesterday about the bad behavior in the mouse-mode demo -- it seems that using #set_pointer() will result in a long delay before an absolute mouse position is updated, even though deltas are reported.

Thus, in CocoaPandaView#, the mouse deltas are sent for both relative and confined modes, so client code will be able to recenter the mouse without choppy movement.

data.title: Support mouse confinement
data.body:
Different take on the earlier patch, making use of a third mouse mode.

This moves the X11 absolute/relative handling from mouse_mode_...() methods into set_properties_now.

data.title: Support M_confine mode (Windows / X11 only so far)
data.body:
Different take on the earlier patch, making use of a third mouse mode.

This moves the X11 absolute/relative handling from mouse_mode_...() methods into set_properties_now.

data.title: Mouse grab support (Windows / X11 only)
data.body:
Add support for grabbing the mouse using WindowProperties#set_mouse_grabbed().

Implementation only for Windows and X11 so far.

data.title: Ignore targetroot/ directory
data.body: This directory is created during build on Linux.

data.title: Fix MeshDrawer::stream
Consolidate distance factor for 3D audio
data.body:
The semantics of distance factor is now same for both OpenAL and Fmod.
The value is given in units per meter, and the default is 1.0.
This means that Panda units are understood to be meters by default.
For example, for feet one would have to set this value to 3.28.

data.title: Fix broken animations when multipart actor have completely overlapping parts
data.body:
Revert "Patch by cfsworks: actor: On removePart, clean up the part's commonBundleHandle."

This reverts commit a4563fb342715bccd9a63aa320395f13abaace46.

commonBundleHandle is not holding bundle for this part only. When
two or more parts shares or have similar bundles - their bundles
are merged. In these cases it is not correct to remove
the commonBundleHandle for this parts.

data.title: Fix missing dependency making parallel builds unreliable.
Miscellaneous fixes
data.body: This fixes a few bugs I encountered while building against a recent ffmpeg (and with SCU disabled).

data.title: makepanda.py --installer fixes for dpkg confusion on Fedora and python3
data.body: The commit messages should describe nicely what I've changed.

data.title: updated direct/particle to import from panda3d.physics
Update README.md
data.body: I put in a mac section on how to install
